abstract: John M. Deutch, 70, has been a Citigroup director for 12 years. He told the board on Monday that he would not stand for re-election at the bank’s next annual meeting, scheduled for April 20.
snippet: John M. Deutch, 70, has been a Citigroup director for 12 years. He told the board on Monday that he would not stand for re-election at the bank’s next annual meeting, scheduled for April 20.
lead_paragraph: John M. Deutch, a former director of the Central Intelligence Agency, is stepping down from Citigroup’s board, the bank disclosed in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission on Thursday. Mr. Deutch, 70, who has been a Citigroup director for 12 years, told the board on Monday that he would not stand for re-election at the bank’s next annual meeting, scheduled for April 20.

headline.main: Ex-Chief of C.I.A. Is Leaving Citi’s Board
